title: Banarasi Silk
hero_image_alt: Golden Zari work on red Banarasi silk
short_description: Luxurious silk saris from Varanasi, famous for their gold and silver brocade or zari, fine silk, and opulent embroidery.
long_description:
A Banarasi sari is a sari made in Varanasi, an ancient city which is also called Benares (Banaras). The saris are among the finest saris in India and are known for their gold and silver brocade or zari, fine silk, and opulent embroidery. 

The saris are made of finely woven silk and are decorated with intricate design, often inspired by Mughal motifs such as intricate intertwining floral and foliate motifs, kalga and bel, a string of upright leaves called jhallar at the outer, edge of border is a characteristic of these saris.

major_centres.title: Varanasi
major_centres.summary: Peeli Kothi and Lallapura are weaving hubs.

authenticity_tips: Look for the GI tag. Reverse side of handloom has floats of threads.
